page.title: 06The Shelton Trencher.
page.content: Mr Shelton,who lives at Underriver Farm,has invented the Slit-trench Digger,it is necessary on his farm because his soil is clay, which is difficult to drain properly.This machine helps with drainage problems by making small trenches which let the water run freely to streams. He invented it in 1979 and he was awarded a silver medal by the Royal Agricultural Society of England. The machines cost between Â£2600-Â£8600.As it uses plastic piping it keeps the fields looking smart.New drainage ware has been brought out recently which keeps out small stones allowing the water to run freely.This resembles an egg box with a filter.It is the only place in the world where this machine is made,making it unique. Tanya
